results.text: There’s a lot more going on around you than you’re used to. The Narrator chooses either sight, hearing, or scent (whichever best fits the situation at-hand). For the next hour, you cannot use that sense when you make a Perception check.
The sudden appearance of a creature catches you off-guard and frightens you. You are frightened of the triggering creature for [[/r 1d4]] rounds.
You are too focused on the minute details to see the big picture. You have disadvantage on your next Perception check.
You are suddenly overwhelmed by a stressful situation, impacting your vision. You are blinded until the end of your next turn.
Your mind was elsewhere, allowing your enemies to get the drop on you. You have disadvantage on your next initiative roll.
You are momentarily distracted, perhaps by a small animal, an insect, or a child. Your passive perception score is reduced by –5 for the next minute.
